title: US intelligence releases joint assessment of threat posed by domestic violent extremism
description: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence on Wednesday released an unclassified summary of a joint assessment of the national security threat posed by domestic violent extremism as ordered by the White House in January.

title: 'Serial stowaway' arrested again at O'Hare Airport
description: 'Serial stowaway' Marilyn Hartman was arrested at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport on Tuesday after leaving the residential facility where she was being electronically monitored.

title: Former Brazilian leader Lula urges Biden to call emergency coronavirus summit
Shooting suspect may have 'sex addiction', police say
description: State and federal investigators are scrambling to learn more about Robert Aaron Long, the suspect in a string of deadly shootings at three Atlanta-area Asian spas, and his alleged motive.

title: Hear former president's first interview since court annulled his 2017 convictions
description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, former Brazilian President, shares whether he plans to run for office.

title: Cardi B and Candace Owens engage in epic Twitter battle
description: Cardi B famously raps "Cardi don't need more press," but if that's the case, she may want to chill on Twitter.

title: Giant manta ray photobombs surfer in Florida
description: A lucky photographer captured an amazing shot of a giant manta ray that leaped out of the water as he was taking pictures of surfers from a Florida beach.

title: Justin Long, the 'I'm a Mac' actor, defects from Apple
description: "I'm a Mac" actor Justin Long is now a PC guy.

title: Interstellar object ʻOumuamua may be a fragment of Pluto-like planet
description: The first observed interstellar object zipped through our solar system in October 2017 -- and astronomers have been trying to understand it ever since.

title: Is Guinness really 'good for you'?
description: Guinness, like other Irish stouts, enjoys a seasonal popularity every St. Patrick's Day. It has also been touted as being "good for you," at least by its own advertising posters decades ago.

title: Chinese bowl bought for $35 at a yard sale sold for over $700,000
description: An exceptionally rare 15th-century Chinese antique that wound up at a yard sale has sold for $721,800 at auction by Sotheby's, exceeding its top estimated sale price of half a million dollars.

title: Why gig economy workers aren't cheering Uber's about-face just yet
description: Uber has made a major concession on labor rights in the United Kingdom. But that doesn't mean the gig economy will transform into a workers' paradise overnight.

title: The UK is facing a reckoning on gender-based violence. Boris Johnson has botched the response
description: "Where is she going?" an officer asks, pointing to my producer as she dives into the crowd around Clapham's bandstand just moments after London's Metropolitan Police begin to move in.

title: Fears grow for Myanmar residents in areas sealed off by military and under internet blackout
description: Concern is growing for the safety of residents in parts of Myanmar's largest city after the military moved to seal off several key areas and impose an information blackout in an apparent bid to quash opposition.

title: He has two metal plates in his jaw after bike crash, but Alonso is excited by F1 return
description: Fernando Alonso just can't get enough of the thrill of traveling at speed. That goes for both two wheels as well as four.

title: A 5,000-mile living wall could hold back the world's largest desert
description: The world's largest desert is growing. In the last century, the Sahara Desert expanded by more than 10%, now covering an area of more than 3.3 million square miles (8.6 million square kilometers) and spanning 11 countries in North Africa.

title: Canada expands use of AstraZeneca vaccine to seniors even as other countries pause its rollout
description: Canada has expanded its rollout of Oxford-AstraZeneca's coronavirus vaccine, reversing an earlier recommendation that it not to be given to seniors, even as more European nations moved to suspend its use.

title: Coronavirus and travel: Everything you need to know
description: Bathed in the faint light at the end of the once seemingly endless pandemic tunnel are visions of trips that reunite us with loved ones or take us to some blissfully new environment.

title: County Sheriff speaks on spa shootings: This is a shock to us all
description: Cherokee County Sheriff Frank Reynolds provides an update after eight people were killed in three Atlanta-area spas.

title: Asian cities challenge London for world's No. 2 financial center title
description: London is fighting to maintain its standing as the best city outside New York for bankers and traders to do business.

title: A 'talking filibuster' isn't going to solve the Senate's problems
description: President Joe Biden threw his significant political weight this week behind an effort to reform the Senate's filibuster process, telling ABC's George Stephanopoulos that "you have to do it what it used to be when I first got to the Senate back in the old days. You had to stand up and command the floor, you had to keep talking."

title: Buckle up. Murder hornet season is around the corner
description: Winter is on its way out. The days are getting longer, vaccinations are ramping up and an end to the pandemic could be in sight.

title: New report shows gravest threat to US democracy comes from within
Biden reiterates pledge to raise taxes on Americans making $400,000 or more
description: President Joe Biden again reiterated he intends to raise taxes for the most wealthy Americans in an ABC News interview aired Wednesday, saying "anybody making more than $400,000 a year will see a small to significant tax increase." He also pledged that individual Americans who make less than $400,000 -- which is more than 90% of taxpayers -- "won't see one single penny in additional federal tax."

title: Gayle King says Prince Harry's conversations with Prince William were 'not productive'
description: CBS host Gayle King, a friend of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, said Prince Harry has spoken to his brother, Prince William, and his father, Prince Charles, since Oprah Winfrey's interview aired but those conversations have not been unproductive. CNN's Max Foster reports.

title: How the letter X is changing the game for travelers
description: When Gemma Hickey tried to travel to Ontario in January 2017 with a Canadian passport marked female, airport personnel questioned it.

title: Policeman tells CNN he was ordered to shoot protesters
description: CNN's Vedika Sud speaks with a Burmese police officer who is in hiding in India. He says he fled Myanmar because he didn't want to follow the military junta's orders to crack down on pro-democracy protesters.

title: P&O launches UK 'cruises to nowhere' for vaccinated passengers
description: British cruise line P&O Cruises has announced it is  to offer "cruises to nowhere" for vaccinated British travelers this summer.

title: Boris Johnson's boast of a 'Global Britain' is taking a pounding
description: Britain's overseas reputation has been tarnished lately, and some of it is entirely self-inflicted.

title: Prince Harry has had 'unproductive' conversations with William and Charles since Oprah interview
description: Prince Harry has spoken to his brother, William, and his father, Charles, since Oprah Winfrey's interview with the Sussexes aired, but those conversations have been "unproductive," Gayle King, a friend of the couple and co-host of CBS show "This Morning," said on Tuesday.

title: What can Jerome Powell do to prevent Wall Street's worst nightmare?
description: Once upon a time, investors' biggest concern was the pandemic that doused markets in uncertainty. No longer.

title: The global chip shortage is still hurting Samsung, Honda and Volkswagen
description: The global chip shortage is continuing to pummel global business, with Samsung, Honda and Volkswagen among the latest major companies to warn of sustained disruption.

title: Chimps from two Czech zoos are Zooming each other every day
description: We humans may be tiring of video calls, Zoom birthdays and streamed performances, but the chimps at two Czech zoos are just starting to enjoy their new live online linkup.

title: Why an oil price 'supercycle' is unlikely
description: Will crude oil prices continue their recent dramatic boom as the pandemic recovery takes hold? Perhaps not.

title: Sabine Schmitz, 'Queen of the Nürburgring,' dead at 51
description: Tributes have flooded in for German racing driver Sabine Schmitz, who has died at the age of 51.

title: This is how US presidents used to travel
description: "You ride along here at night going home. And you look out. You look in the windows and you see the lights on and think... What is going on at that kitchen table? What are people thinking about? What are their real worries?"

title: Top secret Cold War project turned up plants that once thrived beneath mile-deep Greenland ice
description: The ice sheet that covers the northernmost reaches of our planet has expanded and shrunk over the past 2 million years -- but it was thought that Greenland's bitter cold and miles-deep ice had been a more or less constant feature.

title: Camera captures moment boat carrying migrants flips over
description: The US Coast Guard has said increasing numbers of Cubans are making dangerous and illegal trips to the US by boat. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

title: Landmark ruling in Japan paves the way for marriage equality
description: A Japanese court has ruled that not allowing same-sex marriage is unconstitutional, according to Kyodo News agency, a landmark decision that could herald a new era for marriage equality in the country.

title: North Korea blasts K-pop industry as 'slave-like exploitation' amid crackdown on foreign media
description: K-pop is one of South Korea's most popular cultural exports with a growing reach around the world -- but it seems that not everyone is fan.

title: Stories of children separated from parents highlight the price of Hong Kong's coronavirus success
description: When Ariel saw her two young sons isolated in a Hong Kong hospital ward with Covid-19, she broke down. The brothers -- age 5 and 1 and both asymptomatic -- were wearing vests that were tied to their beds to restrain them. They were covered in dirt and both wearing diapers, even the five-year-old.

title: Elliot Page becomes first trans man to appear on Time magazine cover
description: Elliot Page has become the first transgender man ever to appear on the cover of Time, as the Canadian actor opened up about his decision to come out last year.

title: Zoo owner has a close call with python: 'I felt a breeze'
description: Jay Brewer owns The Reptile Zoo in California. While filming a video for Instagram, a python lunged at his face, nearly missing him.

title: CNN's Cuomo slams McConnell's 'scorched earth' threat
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo looks at threats from Senate Minority leader Mitch McConnell to Democrats over a sweeping election bill recently passed in the House and former President Trump saying Republican elections will be hard if that bill passes.

title: New video of 'QAnon Shaman' at the Capitol riot angers judge
description: CNN's Brian Todd reports on newly released video of the "QAnon Shaman" Jacob Chansley walking into the Capitol. The footage angered the judge after Chansley lied in a "60 Minutes" interview and said police waved rioters in on January 6th.
